clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Ginseng Extract on Improvement of Bone Metabolism in Menopausal Women
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-week, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Human Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ginseng Extract on Improvement of Bone Metabolism in Menopausal Women

brief_summary.textblock: Recently, osteoporosis has been recognized as a serious health problem in the elderly, it has also increased in young • middle-aged layer. Ginseng is history 2, 000 years Korean typical herbal medicine which is used as a medicinal is known the mystery of Elixir from a long time ago. A previous study was administered ginseng extract results in animal models induced osteoporosis, the bone-related biomarkers, including improved bone density and bone mass.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators performed a 12-week, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled human trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of ginseng extract on improvement of Bone metabolism in menopausal women. The investigators measured Serum Osteocalcin, Urinary Deoxypyridinoline, DPD/OC ratio, Serum CTX, NTX, Ca, Phosphorus, BSALP(vone specific-alkaline phosphatase), P1NP(Procollagen type 1 N-terminal propeptide), WOMAC index(Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age older than 40 years, after a amenorrhea 6 months in women
- T-score less than -1.0,
- osteocalcin 8(ng/mL) or more and DPD 5.2(nMDPD/mMcreatinine) or more,
- subjects giving written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed osteoporosis
- BMI ≤ 18.5kg/m2 or BMI ≥ 30 kg/m2
- Cardiovascular disease, e.g. arrhythmia, heart failure, myocardial infarction, and patient with pacemaker
- History of disease that could interfere with the test products or impede their absorption, such as gastrointestinal disease or gastrointestinal surgery
- Participation in any other clinical trials within past 2 months
- Laboratory test, medical or psychological conditions deemed by the investigators to interfere with successful participation in the study
- Pregnancy or breast feeding etc,.
